com.sap.conn.idoc

Interface IDocRecordMetaData

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable

    public interface IDocRecordMetaData
extends Serializable
    Interface that stores meta data for an IDoc record.

    • Field Summary

      • UNINITIALIZED

        static final int UNINITIALIZED
        The field info was not initialized yet
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_INVALID

        static final int TYPE_INVALID
        The field info does not contain a valid JCo type
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_CHAR

        static final int TYPE_CHAR
        1-byte or multi-byte character.Fixed sized, blank padded. Corresponds to ABAP type 'C'.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_DATE

        static final int TYPE_DATE
        Date ( YYYYYMMDD ). Corresponds to ABAP type 'D'.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_BCD

        static final int TYPE_BCD
        Packed BCD number, any length between 1 and 16 bytes. Corresponds to ABAP type 'P'.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_TIME

        static final int TYPE_TIME
        Time (HHMMSS). Corresponds to ABAP type 'T'
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_BYTE

        static final int TYPE_BYTE
        Raw data, binary, fixed length, zero padded. Corresponds to ABAP type 'X'.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_ITAB

        @Deprecated
static final int TYPE_ITAB
        Deprecated. This constant is not used and will be removed in a future version.
        Internal table.

        static final int TYPE_NUM
        Digits, fixed size,'0' padded. Corresponds to ABAP type 'N'.

        static final int TYPE_FLOAT
        Floating point, double precision. Corresponds to ABAP type 'F'.

        static final int TYPE_INT
        4-byte integer . Corresponds to ABAP type 'I'.

        static final int TYPE_INT2
        2-byte integer . Corresponds to ABAP type 's'.

        static final int TYPE_INT1
        1-byte integer . Corresponds to ABAP type 'b'.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_STRUCTURE

        static final int TYPE_STRUCTURE
        A heterogeneous structure. Corresponds to ABAP type 'u' and 'v'.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_DECF16

        static final int TYPE_DECF16
        Decimal floating point. Corresponds to ABAP type 'a'.
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.13
        See Also:

        static final int TYPE_DECF34

        See Also:

        static final int TYPE_STRING
        UTF-8 encoded string of variable length. Corresponds to ABAP type 'g'.

        static final int TYPE_XSTRING
        Byte array of variable length. Corresponds to ABAP type 'y'.

      • getDescription

        String getDescription(int index)
        Returns the description of the field at the specified index position.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the field whose description is to be returned.
        Returns:
        the description of the field at the specified index position.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).

        Returns:

      • getValueDescription

        String getValueDescription(String name,
                           String value)
                    throws IDocFieldNotFoundException
        Returns the description for the given valid field value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the field.
        value - field value for which its description is to be returned.
        Returns:
        the description for the given field value; null if the given value is not a valid value.
        Throws:
        IDocFieldNotFoundException - if a field with the given name does not exist.

      • getValues

        String[] getValues(String name)
            throws IDocFieldNotFoundException
        Returns all valid field values. The array elements of the returned String[] are assigned as follows: if an array element's value is a single valid value it contains this value, if it is a valid value range, the array element contains a String of the format "lowValue - highValue".
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the field whose all valid field values is to be returned.
        Returns:
        all valid field values.
        Throws:
        IDocFieldNotFoundException - if a field with the given name does not exist.

      • getValues

        String[] getValues(int index)
        Returns all valid field values. The array elements of the returned String[] are assigned as follows: if an array element's value is a single valid value it contains this value, if it is a valid value range, the array element contains a String of the format "lowValue - highValue".
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the field whose all valid field values is to be returned.
        Returns:
        all valid field values.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).

      • getValueRanges

        String[][] getValueRanges(String name)
                   throws IDocFieldNotFoundException
        Returns all valid field value ranges. The array elements of the returned String[][] are assigned as follows: 
            String[0..n][0] = lowValue_#n;
    String[0..n][1] = highValue_#n;
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the field whose all valid field value ranges is to be returned.
        Returns:
        all valid field value ranges.
        Throws:
        IDocFieldNotFoundException - if a field with the given name does not exist.

      • getValueRanges

        String[][] getValueRanges(int index)
        Returns all valid field value ranges. The array elements of the returned String[][] are assigned as follows: 
            String[0..n][0] = lowValue_#n;
    String[0..n][1] = highValue_#n;
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the field whose all valid field value ranges is to be returned.
        Returns:
        all valid field value ranges.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).

      • isLocked

        boolean isLocked()
        Checks whether the record meta data object is locked.
        Returns:
        true if the record meta data object is locked; false otherwise.

      • isValidValue

        boolean isValidValue(String name,
                     String value)
              throws IDocFieldNotFoundException
        Checks whether the given value is a valid value for the field. This includes also checking the given value's datatype.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the field.
        value - the value to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the given value is a valid value for the field; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IDocFieldNotFoundException - if a field with the given name does not exist.

      • isValidValue

        boolean isValidValue(int index,
                     String value)
        Checks whether the given value is a valid value for the field. This includes also checking the given value's datatype.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the field.
        value - the value to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the given value is a valid value for the field; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).

      • isValidValue

        boolean isValidValue(String name,
                     String value,
                     boolean checkDatatype)
              throws IDocFieldNotFoundException
        Checks whether the given value is a valid value for the field. The checkDatatype flag indicates whether the given value's datatype should also be checked for validity.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the field.
        value - the value to be checked.
        checkDatatype - true if the given value's datatype should also be checked for validity; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the given value is a valid value for the field; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IDocFieldNotFoundException - if a field with the given name does not exist.

      • isValidValue

        boolean isValidValue(int index,
                     String value,
                     boolean checkDatatype)
        Checks whether the given value is a valid value for the field. The checkDatatype flag indicates whether the given value's datatype should also be checked for validity.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the field.
        value - the value to be checked.
        checkDatatype - true if the given value's datatype should also be checked for validity; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the given value is a valid value for the field; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).

      • isValueMatchingDatatype

        boolean isValueMatchingDatatype(String name,
                                String value)
                         throws IDocFieldNotFoundException
        Checks whether the given value is matching the field's datatype.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the field.
        value - the value to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the given value is matching the field's datatype; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IDocFieldNotFoundException - if a field with the given name does not exist.

      • isValueMatchingDatatype

        boolean isValueMatchingDatatype(int index,
                                String value)
        Checks whether the given value is matching the field's datatype.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the field.
        value - the value to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the given value is matching the field's datatype; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).

      • lock

        void lock()
        Locks this record meta data object to prevent further changes. After a meta data object has been locked trying to modify it will cause an IllegalStateException.
